content.text: Machine Learning - Mean Median Mode
Mean, Median, and Mode
What can we learn from looking at a group of numbers?
content.html: What can we learn from looking at a group of numbers?

content.text: In Machine Learning (and in mathematics) there are often three values that interests us:
content.html: In Machine Learning (and in mathematics) there are often three values that interests us:

content.text: Example: We have registered the speed of 13 cars:
content.html: Example: We have registered the speed of 13 cars:

content.text: What is the average, the middle, or the most common speed value?
content.html: What is the average, the middle, or the most common speed value?

content.text: Mean
The mean value is the average value.
content.html: The mean value is the average value.

content.text: To calculate the mean, find the sum of all values, and divide the sum by the number of values:
content.html: To calculate the mean, find the sum of all values, and divide the sum by the number of values:

content.text: The NumPy module has a method for this. Learn about the NumPy module in our NumPy Tutorial .
content.html: The NumPy module has a method for this. Learn about the NumPy module in our NumPy Tutorial.

content.code_html:
import numpy

speed = [99,86,87,88,111,86,103,87,94,78,77,85,86]

x = numpy.mean(speed)

print(x)

content.text: Median
The median value is the value in the middle, after you have sorted all the values:
content.html: The median value is the value in the middle, after you have sorted all the values:

content.text: It is important that the numbers are sorted before you can find the median.
content.html: It is important that the numbers are sorted before you can find the median.

content.text: The NumPy module has a method for this:
content.html: The NumPy module has a method for this:

content.code_html:
import numpy

speed = [99,86,87,88,111,86,103,87,94,78,77,85,86]

x = numpy.median(speed)

print(x)

content.text: If there are two numbers in the middle, divide the sum of those numbers by two.
content.html: If there are two numbers in the middle, divide the sum of those numbers by two.

content.code_html:
import numpy

speed = [99,86,87,88,86,103,87,94,78,77,85,86]

x = numpy.median(speed)

print(x)

content.text: Mode
The Mode value is the value that appears the most number of times:
content.html: The Mode value is the value that appears the most number of times:

content.text: The SciPy module has a method for this. Learn about the SciPy module in our SciPy Tutorial .
content.html: The SciPy module has a method for this. Learn about the SciPy module in our SciPy Tutorial.

content.code_html:
from scipy import stats

speed = [99,86,87,88,111,86,103,87,94,78,77,85,86]

x = stats.mode(speed)

print(x)

content.text: Chapter Summary
The Mean, Median, and Mode are techniques that are often used in Machine Learning, so it is important to understand the concept behind them.
content.html: The Mean, Median, and Mode are techniques that are often used in Machine Learning, so it is important to understand the concept behind them.
